body:
Thanks @tzickel!

That banner is added by readthedocs automatically. I did spend some time in reading through the options and on Google, but couldn't really figure out why the link is wrong. ðŸ¤” 

Any help here is appreciated.

@nicoddemus that banner isn't the one that rtd injects, that banner comes from the flask theme https://github.com/pallets/pallets-sphinx-themes/blob/b0c6c41849b4e15cbf62cc1d95c05ef2b3e155c8/src/pallets_sphinx_themes/themes/pocoo/layout.html#L24-L29

Ahh that's great @stsewd thank you!

Do you have a suggestion on how to fix it?
Sorry, no. I can see the link is being generated wrong here https://github.com/pallets/pallets-sphinx-themes/blob/b0c6c41849b4e15cbf62cc1d95c05ef2b3e155c8/src/pallets_sphinx_themes/versions.py#L135

issue.title: Broken link from development docs to stable docs

labels.name: type: docs
labels.description: documentation improvement, missing or needing clarification

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
The link in the header of https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/ to the documentation of the latest stable release is broken.  It points to https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/5.4.3/index.html instead of https://docs.pytest.org/en/5.4.3/index.html (the `latest` is wrong).

I'm happy to provide a PR to fix this if it's anywhere in the code base.  But I couldn't find it anywhere in the github org.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/152008/85380069-024cd680-b52c-11ea-952f-aab950da720e.png)

issue.title: [Docs] Broken Warning URL to the latest stable version

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Hi guys!

URL in the online documentation warning is broken:
<kbd>![warning](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5850999/86460991-9fc4b900-bd29-11ea-98e7-a079b459cb87.png)</kbd>

After clicking:
<kbd>![page_not_found](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5850999/86461015-aa7f4e00-bd29-11ea-99ed-6c7df669a37b.png)</kbd>

It points to `https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/5.4.3/xunit_setup.html` instead of `https://docs.pytest.org/en/5.4.3/xunit_setup.html` - the `latest` part is not needed.

<kbd>![working](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5850999/86461408-414c0a80-bd2a-11ea-8fbc-cc9f640c1ca1.png)</kbd>

issue.title: Remove warning about development/outdated docs

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Unfortunately couldn't figure out how to fix the generated link, so at least
for now remove it to avoid confusion.

While at it, In the 2nd commit I replaced all references from `pytest.org/en/latest` to `pytest.org/en/stable` given that now our `master` contains features for the next release. 

Fix #7331
